name: VariousCommentTweaks
description: Read the mod name. No, seriously, read it.

configdir.name: Edit Personal Phrases Filter + Favorite/Ignored Users
configdir.description:
<cy>(Hopefully.)</c>
This setting does literally nothing new except being a button that acts as a shortcut to open the config directory for this mod (which is kind of important for using this mod properly, because this is where you will store your word/phrases filter and your favorite/ignored users), because the legendary developers in the Geode Team themselves forgot to add a shortcut button that would have done this exact same thing, and I have gotten far too many folks (rightfully) asking me to find the config directory when using some of my other mods, and I hate repeating the same things over and over again, and I don't know if the next major update for Geode will also repeat this mistake where HJfod forgets to include a config directory shortcut button, so this setting and this button are here for extra insurance, so please enjoy this extra button, I guess. Anyway, by the time you're finished reading this, your device should be finished with opening the config directory; press "Aight" to close this window.

updatelists.name: Refresh Personal Phrases Filter + Favorite/Ignored Users
updatelists.description: Refreshes your personal phrases filter and favorite/ignored users list.

favoriteUsers.name: Highlight Comments From Favorite Users
favoriteUsers.description:
<cl>Original idea by JollySpider.</c>

Highlight comments from <co>your favorite users</c>, based on <cl>text files inside this mod's config directory</c>.
<cy>To</c> <cr>remove</c> <cy>someone from your favorite users, visit</c> <cl>this mod's config directory</c><cy>, edit the relevant text file, and</c> <cp>refresh your lists.</c>

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change. Adding a favorite user does not add them to</c> <cl>your in-game friends list</c><cy>, even though the mod can automatically include your friends as favorite users if you'd like.</c>

friendsAreFavoriteUsers.name: Include Friends List in Favorite Users
friendsAreFavoriteUsers.description: <cy>This will make additional requests to the GD servers. Be careful if you toggle this!</c>

gradientHighlight.name: Use Gradient For Highlighting Favorite Users
gradientHighlight.description:
<cl>Gradients by Brift.</c>

If disabled, comments will be highlighted with a solid color instead.

ignorePeople.name: Hide Comments From Ignored People
ignorePeople.description:
<cl>Original idea by-- what's that?</c>
<cl>They deserve to be on *that* list? Oh.</c>

Hide comments from <co>people you "ignore"</c>, based on <cl>text files inside this mod's config directory</c>.
<cy>To</c> <cr>remove</c> <cy>someone from your ignored users list, visit</c> <cl>this mod's config directory</c><cy>, edit the relevant text file, and</c> <cp>refresh your lists.</c>

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change.</c>
<cr>"IGNORING" PEOPLE DOES</c> <c_>NOT</c> <cr>PRODUCE THE SAME EFFECT AS BLOCKING PEOPLE THROUGH PROFILES.</c>

obfuscateIgnored.name: Obfuscate Usernames + Icons of Ignored People
obfuscateIgnored.description: <cy>Only applies to viewing comments for levels and level lists.</c>

trulyHideIgnored.name: TRULY Hide Comments From Ignored People
trulyHideIgnored.description:
<cl>Original idea by Nightcat.</c>

<c_>TRULY</c> hide comments from people you've ignored.
<c_>NOTHING</c> about the comment will be visible--not the username, the like button, or buttons from other mods attached to the specific comment (including buttons from this mod).

<cy>Note that you'll get a blank space where the ignored person's comment would be, because any other approach risks crashing the game.</c>

blockedAreIgnoredPeople.name: Treat Blocked Users As Ignored People
blockedAreIgnoredPeople.description: <cy>This will make additional requests to the GD servers. Be careful if you toggle this!</c>

personalFilter.name: Personal Phrases Filter
personalFilter.description:
Hide comments containing <co>words or phrases you dislike</c>, based on <cl>text files inside this mod's config directory</c>.
<cy>To</c> <cg>add</c> <cy>or</c> <cr>remove</c> <cy>a word/phrase from your personal phrase filter, visit</c> <cl>this mod's config directory</c><cy>, edit the relevant text file, and</c> <cp>refresh your lists.</c>

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change, and</c> <co>does not apply to your own comments.</c>

hideRoleplay.name: Roleplay Filter
hideRoleplay.description:
<cl>Original idea by jarvisdevil.</c>

Enable a <cy>rudimentary</c> roleplay filter for comments.

<cy>This is a purely cosmetic change, and is not customizable via the config directory. Some comments may be mistaken as roleplay, while others slip past the filter.</c>

<cr>The fact that this feature needed to exist speaks a lot about the cesspool that the daily chat has become.</c>

nameInButton.name: Show Level/List Name Instead of Level/List ID
nameInButton.description:
<cl>Original idea by moonfight.</c>

When viewing comment histories, <co>replace</c> <cl>the level/list ID text</c> with <cl>the name of that level/list</c> <cy>if</c> <co>that level ID has been downloaded</c> <cy>or if</c> <co>that list ID has been added to your favorite lists</c>.

translateComments.name: Translate Comments
translateComments.description:
<cl>Dedicated to TastyForReal. o7</c>

Opens a menu to <cl>translate comments</c> <cy>in your web browser</c>, with three translator options: <cl>LibreTranslate</c>, <cl>DeepL</c>, and <cl>Google Translate</c>.

<cy>Translator API support will</c> <c_>NOT</c> <cy>be a part of this mod.</c>

preferredTranslator.name: Preferred Translator
preferredTranslator.description:
Choose your preferred translator <cj>when holding the SHIFT key (on either side)</c> or <cj>when Deltarune Textboxes is enabled</c>:
<cl>LibreTranslate</c>, <cl>DeepL</c>, or <cl>Google</c>.

sourceLanguage.name: Translation Source Language
sourceLanguage.description:
Select the language you would like to translate <co>from</c>.

<cy>Not all languages are supported by DeepL or LibreTranslate,</c> <co>so choose carefully!</c>

targetLanguage.name: Translation Target Language
targetLanguage.description:
Select the language you would like to translate <co>into</c>.

<cy>Not all languages are supported by DeepL or LibreTranslate,</c> <co>so choose carefully!</c>

blendingComments.name: Readable Mode (Stronger Blending) [READ!]
blendingComments.description:
This setting is here if you use a transparent background surrounding comment text (why?). That's usually not true in most cases, so this is disabled by default.

<cy>For technical reasons, this will not apply when any mods implementing emojis are loaded.</c>

rescaleLargeComments.name: Rescale Large Comments
rescaleLargeComments.description:
<cl>Original idea by CherryChip.</c>

Rescales the comment text in large comments.

<c_>Text from large comments may not fit in its comment box if you enable this.</c>

largeRescaleFactor.name: Large Comments Rescale Factor
largeRescaleFactor.description:
<cl>Original idea by CherryChip.</c>

Choose how much larger/smaller you want the text to be.

<c_>Text from large comments may not fit in its comment box if you change this setting.</c>
